summary: The Chaco Cultural Heritage Area Protection Act of 2025 aims to protect the cultural and historical resources within the Greater Chaco region in New Mexico. It proposes withdrawing certain federal lands from mineral leasing and development to safeguard archaeological sites, sacred areas, and visitor experiences at the Chaco Culture National Historical Park. The bill acknowledges the importance of consultation with local communities, including Indigenous Tribes. It also addresses the impact of oil and gas development and seeks to terminate non-producing leases within the designated area.
